pr_title: [BEAM-10114] Copy Pub/Sub Lite IO from Pub/Sub Lite github to beam.

timeline.message:
Copy Pub/Sub Lite IO from Pub/Sub Lite github to beam.

Also adapt to beam conventions and restrictions.

Copy Pub/Sub Lite IO from Pub/Sub Lite github to beam.

Also adapt to beam conventions and restrictions.

timeline.bodyText:
this will fail on dataflow, it doesn't support SetState or MapState yet.  Dataflow does have its own deduplicate implementation [1] that pushes the work to windmill's own exactly-once impl, you might be able to override this transform w/ that in the runner?  There's also a Deduplicate transform [2] in beam now, but I don't think it'd scale very well.
[1] 
  
    
      beam/runners/google-cloud-dataflow-java/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/runners/dataflow/DataflowRunner.java
    
    
         Line 1729
      in
      8aedab2
    
    
    
    

        
          
           private static class Deduplicate<T> 
        
    
  


[2] https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/8aedab2da96e1324f8433df3c772d59346f825b4/sdks/java/core/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/transforms/Deduplicate.java
timeline.author: steveniemitz

replies.bodyText: Ill change this to use 2, this should work in all runners not just dataflow. I think the extensible approach would be to eventually have the dataflow runner override the deduplicate transform? but thats a bit out of scope for this.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: Done. I've chosen option 2, since I don't want this to be dataflow-specific.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText:
In addition to @experimental, this needs javadoc about how it's not yet supported by GCP.
Maybe this should all live in a directory with "experimental" in the name?  Unfortunately, there's quite a bit of stuff marked @experimental in Beam, so users won't treat it with appropriate caution
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: Using a different directory will require "moving" it later which will have its own hassles. I think the annotation even if users may ignore it is the right way to go.
replies.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: I'm going to mark this as resolved, feel free to reopen?
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: Please add javadoc explaining the current state of this code.  Current directory setup LGTM.
replies.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: Please address this.
replies.author: chamikaramj

timeline.bodyText: Change comments to javadoc style
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: Clarify that the call to addUuids() is assumed to have happened on the publisher side
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: done.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: Beam already has access to an assertThat call in org.hamcrest.MatcherAssert.assertThat.  Do we need this new dependency?

timeline.bodyText: I'm not sure if adding new exceptions here is ok; please check with @kennknowles
timeline.author: dpmills
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -88,6 +88,10 @@
   <suppress id="ForbidNonVendoredGuava" files=".*zetasql.*ExpressionConverter\.java" />
   <suppress id="ForbidNonVendoredGuava" files=".*zetasql.*ZetaSQLPlannerImpl\.java" />

+  <suppress id="ForbidNonVendoredGuava" files=".*pubsublite.*UuidDeduplicationTransformTest\.java" />

replies.bodyText: They should not be required since they seem to be using the import as an implementation detail within the class/method. They should instead depend on the vendored version by importing org.apache.beam.vendor.guava.v26_0_jre....
replies.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: This is not accurate. The client library uses guava ImmutableListMultimap as an input type to represent its attributes: these files need to construct an ImmutableListMultimap and thus need guava.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: I see. I would highly suggest to use APIs that don't depend on guava or for the client library to fix its API as guava is a constant source of compatibility issues for users.
replies.author: lukecwik

replies.bodyText: I don't think its reasonable to avoid guava in the client library in this situation. Doing so leaves users of the client library with a worse api (Map<String, List> instead of ListMultimap<String, ByteString>) for no gain. There is clearly already a non-vendored version of guava within beam, and this library uses the one is used as a common dependency for all google cloud client libraries (i.e. there should always be a version usable by it and all other cloud client libraries). I don't think there's anything to be gained here by removing guava in the public api.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: I believe this is resolved- the api surface now operates on the proto messages themselves due to the added complexity to users WRT dependency issues being more important than the awkwardness of representing a multimap as a list of lists.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: Here and elsewhere, javadoc for classes at least
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: done.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: What does "standard transformation methods" mean? Is this something a user might hit? If so, how would they go about fixing things?
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: added more info.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: link to deduplicate()
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: obsolete.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: This will result in many small bundles downstream, which may end up being inefficient for the PubsubLiteSink.  It will probably perform better to pick a fixed number of keys to reshuffle on, such as maxNumWorkers*10
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: I think this should instead be a modification to Reshuffle.viaRandomKey(). I'm loathe to write custom behavior because the default implementation does something potentially degenerate. WDYT? Could a 'numBuckets' parameter with a reasonable default value be added to Reshuffle.viaRandomKey?
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: Adding a customizable numBuckets to Reshuffle.viaRandomKey sounds good to me.  Leave the default behavior as is to avoid breaking current users, though.
replies.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: Should message_id be converted to PubsubLite's UUID?
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: obsolete.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: This will cast away the type of the input PCollection, and always return PCollection, which seems like a bad consequence of something that is intended to be a passthrough.  Maybe give this a type param?
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: I don't know of a way to do this? Can you describe for me what you'd want the function signature to be?
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: The names of these methods aren't very clear.  I think something like PubsubLiteConversions.sequenceMessageToCloudPubsubMessage would read better.  The distinction between publish and subscribe isn't obvious from the method name anyways, and is probably better in comments.
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: Will drop this method.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText:
Provide more information about when these should be used.
Do we expect it to be a common use case for pipelines to be using both Cloud Pub/Sub and Pub/Sub Lite? We might not need these as part of Beam.
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: Probably not, in any case they wouldn't use the proto PubsubMessage but the beam one. I'm removing most of the functions here.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: removed all but the check. done.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: This is an awkward way for the user to configure the deduplication.  If you want to be future proof it's ok to still have this option, but provide a helper so the user only has to pass the time domain and duration
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText:
I don't really agree with you here. I think Deduplicate already provides a fluent interface for constructing a transform and knows all its properties. I think it mostly seems strange because the builder is wrapped up in the transform itself: if this was DeduplicateKeyedValuesOptions<Uuid, SequencedMessage>, that had a method toTransform(), I don't think it would seem awkward.
I can add this, just think it would be duplicated code for no real gain.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: Yeah, it's the wrapping into a tranform that I don't like.  I'm fine with leaving this as is if you add an example as I mentioned in a comment above
replies.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: Registering a coder as part of expand is weird, and will be confusing if the user uses these types elsewhere in the pipeline.  You can instead use the @defaultcoder annotation on Uuid and SequencedMessage to set their default coders globally.
timeline.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: Uuid and SequencedMessage are part of the Pub/Sub Lite client library, not beam. Is there a way to register a default coder somewhere not in the type definition?
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: ah sorry, thatts only true of SequencedMessage. Will make this change for Uuid.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText: done for uuid, is there a way to set this globally on the SequencedMessage type that comes from the Pub/Sub Lite java client library?
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText:
Yeah, you can create a CoderProviderRegistrar.  There's an example from another IO solving the same problem here: https://github.com/apache/beam/blob/master/sdks/java/io/hbase/src/main/java/org/apache/beam/sdk/io/hbase/HBaseCoderProviderRegistrar.java
In that provider, add default coders for SequencedMessage and Message
Also, remove the registerCoderForClass calls here
replies.author: dpmills

replies.bodyText: Done.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText:
Google cloud pubsublite depends on grpc 1.29 and has other deps that differ greatly from the common set used within Beam.
Please validate that no additional linkage errors were produced using the linkage checker for all impacted modules and post the results here. You will need to resolve linkage errors by either downgrading the version of the library used to one that is compatible with the current versions in Beam or upgrading Beam's dependencies till they are compatible with the library.
timeline.author: lukecwik
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -480,6 +479,7 @@ class BeamModulePlugin implements Plugin<Project> {
         google_cloud_datacatalog_v1beta1            : "com.google.cloud:google-cloud-datacatalog:$google_cloud_datacatalog_version",
         google_cloud_dataflow_java_proto_library_all: "com.google.cloud.dataflow:google-cloud-dataflow-java-proto-library-all:0.5.160304",
         google_cloud_datastore_v1_proto_client      : "com.google.cloud.datastore:datastore-v1-proto-client:1.6.3",
+        google_cloud_pubsublite                     : "com.google.cloud:google-cloud-pubsublite:$google_cloud_pubsublite_version",

replies.bodyText: Will run this, this tool requires a git repo, while I'm using hg-git for these. IDK if its possible to make this not dependent on the source control tool? In the meantime, I'll clone my repo using git and run the tool.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

replies.bodyText:
This tool fails to run in a git clone of the branch. Please fix this tool?
/bin/bash ./sdks/java/build-tools/beam-linkage-check.sh
Updating files: 100% (4678/4678), done.
HEAD is now at 9304d1c90 Check for null attribute map in IncomingMessage before adding on PubsubMessage.

beam ❯

lukecwik

replies.bodyText: I guess the error went to /dev/null. Checking dpcollins-google:pubsublite_beam branch.
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText:
I had to run "gradlew clean". Then it went well; no new linkage errors in dpcollins-google:pubsublite_beam branch. Good. https://gist.github.com/suztomo/57e888b95556e5741cced3999313a2f8
I'll update the script so that it should not swallow error messages https://issues.apache.org/jira/browse/BEAM-10298
As per dependency on Git, because the tool compares two Git branches for their dependencies, it's coupled with Git.
replies.author: suztomo

replies.bodyText: I think this is resolved as it doesn't cause dependency conflicts.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: Could you send the update to core as a separate PR ?
timeline.author: chamikaramj

replies.bodyText: These are only minor changes to the transform and this is the only file not directly related to pubsub lite io that is changed. Given the high latency on merging beam PRs and the fact that this change was proposed in this pr (see millsd@ comments above), I'd prefer not to.
replies.author: dpcollins-google

timeline.bodyText: Did you run into an issue when using existing Reshuffle implementation ?
timeline.author: chamikaramj

replies.bodyText: It was suggested by millsd@ above in this pr that it would have degenerate performance and lead to single key bundles, so he suggested I rewrite it like this.
replies.author: dpcollins-google
